name: Archer
description: Archers fight primarily with bows and crossbows. As such, they tend to try and
keep their opponents at a distance. They also typically equip light armor in
order to retain the ability to outpace opponents with heavier armor and
weapons.

name: Bard
description: Bards wield special weapons allowing them to perform direct combat as well as
to perform songs using MP which can both empower friends and weaken foes.
However, the bard's abilities can be a bit unpredictable at times and so
knowing exactly when and where to use which abilities can have a huge impact on
how well this class performs in battle.

name: Knight
description: Knights tend to favor heavy armor and physical weapons. However, this is not a
steadfast rule and magic can be added to the class to make it play more like a
paladin or spell sword if desired.

name: Mage
description: To keep Kite simple, and to keep this section from being too bloated with
redundant or otherwise similar classes; the "Mage" class includes all schools
of magic. Meaning, a player chooses what type of mage they want to play
typically by taking particular spell set. For example, a mage aligning
themselves with the light element could take spells focusing on healing as well
as sealing and exorcising undead. While a mage playing as a necromancer might
choose raise corpse, summon skeleton, and other similar spells.

name: Martial Artist
description: Martial artists use unarmed attacks to fight and through training are able to
increase their physical attack and defense to a point which can rival armed
combatants. Additionally many martial artists are able to utilize MP to perform
some advanced techniques which are stored in belts. However, martial artists
refer to this usage as ki or chi and using the term magic or mana around them
could lead to debate.

name: Ninja
description: Ninjas are a class of fighter who use a mixture of stealth and magic to perform
assassinations on their targets. Unlike rogues, ninjas focus more combat vs.
gathering information and stealing items. However, these activities aren't
outside the realm of possibility either.

name: Rogue
description: Rogues favor stealth and resourcefulness over brute force. Rogues are also
usually fairly decent at getting into places or acquiring information. However,
this also means they tend to favor things such as using the environment, traps,
poison, or other indirect means of dealing damage vs. facing their opponents
directly

name: Tradesman
description: This is a general term used to encompass all crafting and merchant classes.
Generally speaking the tradesman's class is usually named after whatever
crafting skill they choose. i.e. alchemy = alchemist, smithing = blacksmith,
etc.

items.name: One item required to use chosen crafting skill.
items.notes: Must be weakest item in class e.g. copper, pine, etc.
